newsitem.title: USA: Olsten Corp says it is target of state probe.
newsitem.headline: Olsten Corp says it is target of state probe.

text.p: Olsten Corp said Wednesday that the New Mexico Health Care Anti-Fraud Task Force is looking into allegations of improper billing and fraud by one of its units.

Olsten said the probe involves billing for various federally-funded medical programs of Quantum Health Resources, which Olsten acquired in June 1996, and the company formed after the acquisition, Olsten Health Services' Infusion Therapy division.
Olsten said the investigation focuses on the period between January 1992 and April 1997.

Olsten, a home health care and staffing services provider, said it has given information to the U.S. Department of Justice and the Office of the Attorney General of New Mexico, which it said are probing Quantum's health care practices.
"We intend to continue to work closely with various government agencies to provide the requested information needed to resolve the questions raised," a statement from the company said.
